item.title: Investigators ask the South Korean MP to accuse the deposit leader
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption office recommended yesterday to the Public Prosecution Service that the deposed president, Yoon Suk-Youol, is accused of rebellion and abuse of power by declaring martial law in December. The High employee corruption investigation office (CIO) has announced that it has transferred the case to the prosecutor, which has the power to formally accuse a South Korean head of state. Cio considers that Yoon conspired with then-National Defense Minister Kim Yong-Hyun and other military officers to start a riot, declaring martial law on the night of December 3. It argues, moreover, that Yoon has abused power by sending troops to the National Assembly (Parliament) to prevent deputies from revoking martial law. The Public Prosecution Service now has 11 days to decide whether or not to start the requested process. If Yoon is considered guilty of leading an insurrection, a crime for which a president has no immunity in the country, he may be sentenced to life imprisonment or the death penalty. Yoon is in custody at the Seoul Detention Center in Uiwang, south of Seoul, since January 15. The Constitutional Court is simultaneously made a judgment to determine whether or not to ratify the dismissal approved by parliamentarians on December 14. If the highest court in South Korea confirms the impeachment, early presidential elections have to be called within 60 days after the court decision. Yoon refuses to witness in the investigation into the alleged crime of rebellion. Yoon Suk-Youol surprised the country on December 3 by declaring martial law, a measure reminiscent of black days of the South Korean military dictatorship and that justified with the intention of protecting the country from “North Korean Communist forces” and “Eliminate elements hostile to the state”. Pressured by the deputies and thousands of protesters, Yoon was forced to revoke the decision hours later.

Beijing also widened a consumer goods exchange system and increased the salaries of millions of civil servants to revive internal demand. "The [Chinese] government has said it will launch more measures to stimulate the economy," said Vitaly Umansky, who expects mainly a recovery of the middle class confidence: "I think it will happen, it's just a matter of time." item.title: Traffic | Lawyer appeals to the end of “moral judgments” with images
item.description:
The causal Luís Ho Ka considers that the use of traffic chambers can lead to cases in court, and that the images captured must be sent to the authorities, rather than shared on social networks
Lawyer Luís Ho Ka has defends the use of traffic surveillance chambers by drivers, but appeals to the government to take steps to avoid the use of images for “moral judgments”. The opinion of the causal was shared to the newspaper or Mun, following an incident at the head of the Portuguese School of Macao, in which images of a lawyer of Portuguese nationality were shared. Heard by the newspaper or Mun, the lawyer considered that recording videos by chambers installed on vehicles may be important, namely when there are accidents and the need to activate the automobile insurance. However, Ho Ka has pointed out that the vehicle cameras cannot be transformed into a mobile surveillance system used to make “moral judgments” on social networks. Ho also explained that the images captured by the vehicles must be delivered to the authorities, instead of being published online, and that those responsible for recording should only refer them to the authorities, following the legal proceedings provided. If the images have public interest, they can be used. However, if the use of images exceeds the scope of the process and investigations of the authorities, as is the case with publications on social networks, and if there are elements that can be considered as insulting or defamatory, then the person responsible for capturing and disclosure may face Criminal liability.
Legal problems Luís Ho Ka Hou also indicated that, according to the judicial perspective, the appropriate use of recorded images in traffic is captured the accidents, to hold it and cooperate with the authorities, in case it is necessary to collect evidence. If there is no consent of the recorded people, and if the content is published on social networks for moral judgments, then we are facing cases that are hardly under the appropriate recording, which may lead to violation of the law of personal data protection or other image rights. Ho ka has also warned that “judgments” on social networks can cause damage to the rights to privacy and the good name of the parties involved. About two weeks ago a driver was captured in traffic, after passing a red light, parking in a forbidden place and making an obscene gesture with children. The images, which allowed the driver to identify, were shared online, which held a campaign against the visa, including with dismissal requests from the employer, as well as several hate comments with xenophobic expressions.

item.title: Portugal | Rocha Vieira “decisive” for democracy
item.description:
The Assembly of the Republic unanimously approved a vote of regret proposed by José Pedro Aguiar-Branco, in which Rocha Vieira is considered a relevant personality in the construction of Portuguese democracy
The Parliament of Portugal unanimously approved a vote of regret of the Assembly of the Republic by the death of General Rocha Vieira, former governor of Macau, considered a relevant personality in the construction of Portuguese democracy. Minister of the Republic in the Azores between 1986 and 1991, governor of Macao between 1991 and 1999, during the period of the transfer of sovereignty of this territory to China, General Vasco Rocha Vieira, born in Lagoa, died on Wednesday at the age of 85. In the vote subscribed by José Pedro Aguiar-Branco, it refers that Rocha Vieira performed functions as head of the army state between 1976 and 1978 and integrated, in care, the Council of Revolution, being a “decisive figure of political life and Portuguese military ”. “His military career also included services in Angola and Macao, where he was chief of staff of the Independent Territorial Command and Deputy Secretary for Public Works during the transition to democracy. Degree in Civil Engineering, it accumulated several military and civil awards, including the Great Cross of the Military Order of the Tower and Sword. He was also a chancellor of the Council of the Old Military Orders, between 2006 and 2016 ”, reads in the text proposed by the President of the Assembly of the Republic.
“Iconic image” José Pedro Aguiar-Branco considers later that “the Portuguese recall the iconic image of General Rocha Vieira, at the Macao Administration Transfer ceremony, holding the Portuguese flag”. “They also recognize their high testimony of service, patriotism and civic dedication. The Assembly of the Republic (…) expresses its deep regret for the death of General Vasco Rocha Vieira and pays tribute to this prominent Portuguese army officer, so relevant in the construction of our democracy, ”he adds. In his career in the Armed Forces, Rocha Vieira was also a national military representative at the Supreme Headquarters of NATO's allied powers in Europe-Shape, Belgium, and Honorary Director of Arms and Engineering. He was an honorary associate of the Lisbon Geography Society, the Historical Society of Independence of Portugal and the Combatants League, and was appointed a member of the EDP General and Supervision Council in 2012. Funeral funeral funerals took place on Friday, as well as the celebration of a present body mass and a procession that followed Lisbon to Algarve, where a new Mass was celebrated in the Mother Church of Lagoa. The funeral was held at the Lagoa Cemetery, and the City Council decreed three days of municipal mourning.

item.title: Hospitality | More than 14.4 million guests in 2024
item.description:
Last year, Macao hotels hosted more than 14.4 million people, with the average occupancy rate of rooms reaching 86.4 percent, an annual climb of almost 5 percent. Room prices in 5-star hotels rose 2.8 percent, with the average spell fixed at 1,585 patacas
The Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) yesterday revealed that last year the hotel establishments of Macau hosted about 14,433,000 people, totaling a 6.4 percent increase with 2023. Statistical data show the significant climb of international customers, which totaled more than 1.1 million, with an annual growth of 57.4 percent. In this chapter highlight to guests from the Republic of Korea, who duplicated annually, and reached the 321 thousand. Also the number of guests of Malaysia (87,000), Japan (81,000), India (73,000) and Singapore (68,000) ascended 53.4, 49.1, 97.2 and 24.1 percent respectively. From a more operational perspective, in 2024 the industry registered an average occupancy rate of 86.4 percent guest rooms, plus 4.9 percentage points compared to 2023. The 5 -star hotels were the ones that recorded the highest occupancy rates Rooms (88.6 percent), with a rise of 6.1 percent. Medal sides During 2024, the average price of the five -star hotel rooms was 1,585 patacas, an increase of 2.8 percent compared to 2023, second data from the Macao Hotel Association, cited by the Tourism Services Directorate. The data reveal that last year's prices were only 0.6 percent below the 2019 registration The month of December exceeded the average prices practiced throughout 2024, with the average price in 4 and 5 star hotels reaching 1,624 patacas, yet a decrease of 8.1 percent compared to December 2023. Highlight for Last month that completed six consecutive months of homologous prices falls, a descent that began in July. At the end of last year there were 146 hotel establishments that provided public accommodation services (+4, compared to the end of the year 2023), providing a total of 43,000 rooms of guests (-7.8 percent).

item.title: Architecture | USJ student wins best thesis project award
item.description: Vera Vong, an architectural student at the University of São José (USJ), has just won the “Best Architecture Project in Asia”, obtaining the “D'Ouro Award” category in the competition “Arcasia Thesis of the Year (Toy) 2024 ”. At issue is the final undergraduate project, entitled “Undulating Connections”, and with it Vera Vong has also gained special “best [project] innovation and originality” and “best in global guidance” prizes. In addition, the project of this building “has two exhibition rooms, an auditorium, two galleries, a public exhibition area, a coffee and a viewpoint”, being intended “to a center of networking, tourism support, Encouraging economic growth and increased intercultural interaction in Macao ”, if it was built. item.title: Afghanistan | Beijing calls for severe punishment for authors of the murder of Chinese citizen
item.description: China yesterday appealed to the Afghan authorities to do an "exhaustive investigation" and "severely punish" those responsible for the murder on Wednesday of a Chinese citizen who worked on a gold mine in Takhar's Afghan province. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said yesterday at a press conference that Beijing is “deeply shocked” with the attack. "China is against all forms of terrorism," said the spokesman, appealing to the "repression of the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations listed by the UN Security Council." "China will continue to pay close attention to the security situation in Afghanistan and to support Afghan authorities in combating all forms of terrorist violence and maintaining security and stability in the country," Mao added, urging the Afghan government to Take the necessary measures "to ensure the safety of citizens and Chinese organizations in the country." According to local police, the victim worked in a gold mine in the region, which borders Tajiquistan. A local branch of the Islamic State Islamic Group claimed the authorship of the attack. China is one of the few international actors that has maintained diplomatic relations with Afghanistan since the Taliban reached power in August 2021. The two countries share a small international border of just 76 kilometers in the eastern part of the so -called Wajan corridor, a remote passage in the Pamir Range. Chinese companies, with the support of Beijing, have sought to take advantage of opportunities to explore the vast deposits of non -developed resources from Afghanistan, especially Mes Aynak Mine, which is believed to contain the largest copper deposit in the world.

And as for the descendants of the dragon “good things come to peers” (好事成双 hǎo shì chéng shuāng), promises good agriculture and fertility, being equally conducive to meditation and contact with nature, but also social contacts, because The wooden serpent, given its element, is the most communicative, creative, friendly and favorable to relationships between these reptiles. The serpent is the strongest sex symbol and, therefore, in Indian Yoly philosophies of the Tantric line, which extend throughout Asia and, in particular by Southeast Asia, it is Kundalini, as it well caught the attention C.G. At first they were quite spontaneous, they had an animist philosophy that evolved into popular Taoism, but it must not be forgotten that also from an early age, from Confucius and the establishment of Confucianism, and in a systematic way since Han, has had In this culture a great determination to control the natural energies. This trend has redoubled the acceptance of Buddhist philosophy, initially far from the natural and tantric experiences. During the time of the last Qing dynasty, religious experiences linked to Buddhism intensified and, as such, the conflict between natural and spiritual forces became manifest, opening a war similar to what we assist in Christianity, with Eve and Adam to be expelled from paradise because of a supposedly infamous serpent. The open war between natural forces and formal religion would still be recorded in Chinese literature, in one of the most poignant love stories, entitled to White Serpent (Bai Shé Zhuàn), also known by the names of its protagonists Xu Xian (许仙 xǔ Xiān) and bai niangzi (白娘子 Bai niángzi), which reached the heyday during the Qing dynasty. In it lovers are hopelessly persecuted by a Buddhist Bonzo, who destroys their happiness by insisting that Xu Xian (许仙) move away from Bai Niangzi (白娘子), as she was an enchanted serpent. The strength of the serpent is complete in itself. There is nothing to add to you. Attesting to its perfect completeness, there is a very told proverbial story, drawing feet to the serpent (畫/画蛇添足 huà shiān zú), often shortened in the expression the serpent feet (shé zú 蛇足). 古时候 ， 楚国有一家人 ， 祭完祖之后 ， 准备将祭祀用的一壶酒 ， 赏给帮忙办事的人喝。帮忙办事的人很多 ， ， 若是让一个 若是让一个人喝 ， 那能喝得有余。这一壶酒到底怎么分呢？大家都安静下来 ， 这时有人建议：每个人在地上画一条蛇 ， 谁画得快 ， 这壶酒就归他喝。大家都认为这个方法好 ， 都同意这样做。于是 ， 在地上画起蛇来。 有个人画得很快 ， 一转眼最先画好了 ， 他就端起酒壶要喝酒。但是他回头看看别人 ， 还都没有画好呢。心里想：他们画得真慢。他洋洋得意地说： “你们画得好慢啊！我再给蛇画几只脚也不算晚呢！” 于是 ， 他便左手提着酒壶 ， 右手给蛇画起脚来。正在他一边给蛇画脚 ， 一边说话的时候 ， ， ， 另外一个人已经画好了。那个人马上把酒壶从他手里夺过去 “你见过蛇吗？蛇是没有脚的 ， 你为什么要给它添上脚呢？所以第一个画好蛇的人不是你 ， 而是我了！ ”那个人说罢就仰起头来 ， 咕咚咕咚把酒喝下去了。 Here's my translation: In ancient times, in the Kingdom Chu (楚國/国 Chǔ Guó), there was a feudal gentleman who, after giving the appropriate ritual libations to the ancestors, still left a jar of wine, which he thought to distribute to his employees. But since these were many, the wine didn't come to everyone, but for one it would be more than enough. After all, how did it be shared? To calm down one of them suggested, "Each one will draw a snake on the floor, which end first, will get the jar of wine." Everyone agreed with the idea and so began to draw. There was one who was full of desire to drink him, so he dispatched the drawing in an open and close eye. Looking at others, he saw that they were not over yet, so he thought they were very slow and said triumphly, "You are so slow that I even have time to add feet to the serpent!" Then, as he clung to his left hand in the jar, with his right added his feet to the reptile. Therefore, this said is used to show someone to do something superfluous. When the serpent intends to be different, it has opened the path of metamorphosis, similar to that of the silk bug and butterfly. The Chinese are well aware of the power of the serpent (shé 蛇), whose etymological reading is the worm radically another, the animal, the antithetical force of the civilized. This immense natural energy was renamed as a little dragon (小龙 Xiǎo Lóng) to make room for the reptile to cultivate and exercise on the spiritual way, in an inner body to mind, without, however, losing its telluric roots. item.title: Death | Died Rocha Vieira at 85
item.description:
Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macau, died yesterday at the age of 85. The general had been sick for a long time. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa recalled him as “one of the most illustrious officers” of the army, but to Macau, Rocha Vieira is for history as the great worker of the measures decided in the 1987 joint statement
It has long been sick, even failing some recent events in Lisbon about Macau and the transition. Vasco Rocha Vieira, General, former Chief of Staff of the Army, and the last Portuguese governor of Macau, died yesterday morning at 85 years old. Born on August 16, 1939, he held the position of Governor of Macao between 1991 and 1999, when the transfer of the territory to China was processed. However, Rocha Vieira already had a connection to Macau, as he was in the territory after April 25. In addition, he was also Minister of the Republic of the Azores between 1986 and 1991. One of the first personalities to react to his death in Portugal was the President of the Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, who expressed, in a official note, the “deep regret” for the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, recalling him as “one of the more distinguished army officials and praising its “marked patriotism”. In a note published on the official website of the Presidency of the Republic on the Internet, the head of state recalls Rocha Vieira as "one of the most illustrious officers of the Portuguese army in the transition to democracy and in the first decades of his statement." “Always closely linked to commands, it has also performed political functions such as Minister of the Republic for the Autonomous Region of the Azores,” is remembered in the note. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa also points out that Rocha Vieira was “very close to President António Ramalho Eanes”, having been “designated chancellor of the old military orders”. “The symbolism of the moment of transferring the Portuguese administration to the Chinese will remain in the memory of many Portuguese as an example of meaning, meaning of the public cause and marked patriotism,” reads the note of regret. The President of the Republic, who claims to have followed “closely the last months” of Rocha Vieira's life, “presents to his family, and, much in particular, to his widow and children, the testimony of gratitude of Portugal, with very longing friendship". In his biography, entitled “To all the ports I arrived”, the moment Mário Soares, then President of the Republic, said to Rocha Vieira: “I need yourself. Go to Macau and see if it puts that in order ”, in reference to the case of Macau fax, related to the construction of Macao International Airport, which so many headaches gave its predecessor, Carlos Watermelon, also deceased. The general will then replied that nothing demanded to go to Macau. “I didn't ask you anything, nor did I put it in conditions. I went to Macau with the same spirit with which I went to the Azores. It was not a political position inherent in a career. It was, in fact, a mission, ”he describes. Then it was Rocha Vieira and his team to achieve all objectives and ideal for the future of Macao present in the joint statement that had been signed between Portugal and China in 1987. The government led by Rocha Vieira saw the airport was born, built The entire bilingual legislative framework that is still in place today and raised the Macao Cultural Center, inaugurated by Jorge Sampaio on March 19, 1999, among many other initiatives, including in the area of ​​urbanism. A "GREAT FRIEND" Rocha Vieira came, by the way, to make the place available to the Macau Executive when Jorge Sampaio was elected President of the Republic, at the turn from 1995 to 1996. “When I went to Macau I didn't know how things were going to run and how long I was going There stayed there, ”he recalled in his biography. However, and despite Sampaio's initial hesitation in change, the truth is that Rocha Vieira turned out to be, because “her replacement would affect the regular sequence of the process” at a time when “the passage was already in sight was already in sight From territory administration to China, ”it is described in“ all the ports I arrived ”. Speaking to RTP, Chito Rodrigues, a general governor of Macao in office, left words of regret for the death of the one who was a friend. “I remember him as a great friend and honorary partner of the Combatants League. He has always related to us and is our reference. We knew it was bad and we were not, in a way, surprised [with the news of death], but it is always an unpleasant surprise. ” Chito Rodrigues recalls him in the exercise of his duties in Macau as someone who contributed "so that Macao was a quiet place for decolonization to be done in a" exemplary "way." “I was with him at the opening of the airport and had close relations with him as governor. It was someone who replaced his predecessors successfully and humble, replacing the tradition of military governors in Macao, ”he added. In Fernando Lima and Eduardo Cintra Torres, the former Hong Kong governor, Chris Patten, recalled Rocha Vieira as "a brave and judicious man, with enormous integrity and an excellent server of his country." "I think Portugal was very lucky to have such a good man as the last governor, such a difficult place," he said. The controversy The name of Rocha Vieira was, however, wrapped in some controversies, namely with the creation of the Jorge Álvares Foundation and the Oriente Foundation, especially regarding the funds allocated to these two entities. "The bulk of public opinion of the territory and the authorities of Beijing contested the legitimacy of a contract under which an entity based in Lisbon was fueled with resources generated in Macao," reads the biography of Rocha Vieira. This only intended the Foundation to “play a payroll role for Macao, and the controversy has been diluted over time. On social networks, the journalist and former director of Macau today, João Severino said “mourn a lot” the disappearance of Rocha Vieira. “General Vasco Rocha Vieira left us after several weeks hospitalized at the hospital. Macao's last governor was a good man for many people and discriminatory for many. In any case his military career was exemplary and left marks in the administration of Macao. I kept with the illustrious governor some controversial moments, always within the greatest cordiality and consideration by the maximum representative of my country in Macau. I present to your wife Dr. Leonor and his children my condolences and rest in peace, ”he wrote. An entity that reacted to the disappearance of Rocha Vieira was the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry (CCILC), which on social networks issued a note of regret about the death of the 138th Portuguese Governor of Macao and presided at the CCILC Strategic Council. “General Rocha Vieira played a striking and exemplary role throughout his life, standing out for his commitment to service to the nation, dedication to relations between Portugal and China, and the historical role in closing the administration cycle Portuguese in Macau. ” The same note also states that "in the leadership of the CCILC Strategic Council, his strategic vision, wisdom and human values ​​have always been a source of inspiration for the entire direction and executive team." Also the Lisbon City Council officially reacted to its disappearance. “Rocha Vieira dedicated her life to the defense of the national interest, notably serving Portugal as the army's head of the army and as the last governor of Macao. Vision statesman assured a peaceful transfer from Macao sovereignty to China. Man of courage, contributed to the consolidation of the democratic process, being a fundamental piece of November 25, 1975. It was an honor to count on his testimony in the first evocation ceremony of November 25 in the Paços do County in 2023. ” Goodbye to Macau The images of Rocha Vieira to hold the Portuguese flag to her chest are celebrated on December 19, 1999, with a visibly thrilled face, as well as goodbye to the “mission” he agreed to perform in Macao. After his role as governor, Rocha Vieira was maintaining narrow ties with the territory, and the last time he was in Macau was in 2023, to receive the distinction of Honoris Causal Doctorate from the Macao University of Science and Technology. Then he stressed that the "good historical relationships" with China are "a trump card for Portugal" and that today the country is "a superpower in affirmation". The general said that “another great asset” for Portugal is interest in China in the Portuguese language, underlining the growing number of Chinese universities that teach Portuguese. At the end of 2020, the coordinator of the Portuguese Language Pedagogical and Scientific Center of the Macao Polytechnic University, Gaspar Zhang Yunfeng, said there were about 50 higher education institutions with Portuguese courses in mainland China. “China is interested in that Portuguese develops (…) also to be able to have, through Portugal, a narrower relationship with Portuguese -speaking countries,” said Rocha Vieira. In a last interview with Lusa agency in 2019, Rocha Vieira recalled the times in Macau and her vicissitudes, especially regarding the transition process. “I had more problems with the Portuguese part than with the Chinese part (…) often, for lack of perception. Normally, people are far away in Lisbon - this is a historical thing, which is not just now - and think they know the solutions better than those in Macao, ”he said. Rocha Vieira assured that when it was necessary to define “the course, the fundamental objectives of Macao policies, were discussed by the Macao government in Lisbon, with whom they should be discussed, with the President of the Republic and the Prime Minister”, there is “always” about this “a great understanding on the part of the Portuguese sovereignty organs and a great proof of confidence in those in the territory”.

item.description: European countries will be subject to customs tariffs, "the only form" of the United States "to be treated as they should be," US President Donald Trump said Tuesday. “The European Union (EU) is very bad for us. They treat us very badly. They do not accept our cars or our agricultural products. In fact, they don't accept much, ”said the president of the United States, adding that they will be tariffs. Asked by the press at the White House, Trump also assured that his administration is discussing “10 percent rates on Chinese products, because they send [the opioid] fentanil to Mexico and Canada”, which is ends up consumed in the states United. "It is probably for February 1," added Donald Trump, which corresponds to the date announced the day before for the application of 25 percent rates on Mexican and Canadian products. China reacted yesterday, claiming to be "firmly determined" to "defend their national interests." "We have always believed that there are no winners in a trade war or a tariff war," said Mao Ning, spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference. The president of the European Commission (EC), Ursula Von der Leyen, who participated in the Davos Economic Forum, Switzerland, on Tuesday, ensured that Europe is ready to talk to the United States government, remembering that Washington is a important commercial partner. Our first priority is to quickly start conversations about our common interests and be ready to negotiate, ”he said:“ We will be pragmatic, but we will keep firm in our principles: to defend our interests and respect our values, ”he said the European leader. "Europe will continue to defend cooperation, not only with our longtime friends (…) but also with all the countries with which we have common interests," added von der Leyen. “Our message to the rest of the world is simple: we are ready to dialogue with you if this can lead to mutual benefits,” he added, ensuring that he intends to “deepen” relations between Brussels and Beijing. New During his presidential campaign, Trump had already denounced the US commercial deficit of the EU, comparing block to “a small China” and accusing him of taking advantage of the world's first economic power. "We have a commercial deficit with the EU of $ 350 billion," he insisted on Tuesday, noting that "China is aggressive, but it is not only China, other countries are also big aggressors." The US commercial deficit with the EU will rise to $ 131 billion in 2023, according to data from the White House Commercial Representative (USTR), and is mainly concentrated in four countries: Germany, France, Ireland and Italy. Before being reelected, Donald Trump had already threatened the EU with the imposition of customs rights on European products unless the block increased their US oil and gas purchases. The European Commissioner for the Economy, Valdis Dombrovskis, guaranteed on Monday, after Trump's inauguration, that the EU is “ready to defend its economic interests,” as it has done “during the first Trump administration when it introduced tariffs on steel and aluminum ”.

item.title: Death / Rocha Vieira: Macau recalls last Portuguese governor
item.description: Macao's last governor, Vasco Rocha Vieira, who died at age 85, launched the foundations of the success of the Chinese region and defended the rights of civil servants, although with "some mismatches," local leaders told Lusa. Vasco Rocha Vieira, former army's head of the army between 1976 and 1978, died in the early hours of Monday at the age of 85, confirmed to the Portuguese official source of that military industry. “It is an illustrious figure, fundamental in the history of the transition of Macau, but also, to some extent, of the present and the future,” said José Sales Marques, president of Leal Senate, former City Council, between 1993 and 1999. “There is a lot Thing that was done during this period and which continues today. The foundations of the Special Administrative Region of Macau have a lot to do with the work of Lieutenant General Rocha Vieira ”, defended Sales Marques. Rocha Vieira held the position of governor of Macau between 1991 and 1999, when the transfer of the territory to China was processed. It was in his mandate that the construction of the city's airport was completed. The Macao that Rocha Vieira found and the one that left “does not compare. What has been done in those years is all anything that history has already recorded, ”said Sales Marques. also a member of the then Advisory Board of Rocha Vieira. Former Deputy António NG Kuok Cheong told Lusa that, despite the distrust of the Chinese, the administration "tried to do something to encourage the city's economic growth, which was very poor at that time, before returning Macao." António NG, elected to the Legislative Assembly five months after the appointment of Rocha Vieira, stressed that the main obstacle was China's resistance to the liberalization of the game sector, which would only be released in 2002. Something that forced the Portuguese administration to sell land to finance infrastructure projects, inadvertently planting the roots of the housing problem that Macau currently faces, he said. “They tried to sell the land openly, but the Chinese government prevented them. Thus, most land was sold to powerful people in China for a very low price, because Macau's economy was very weak, ”said NG. A class of landlords was created who, after Macao became the world capital of casinos, enriched by controlling the offer and maintaining the housing prices high, lamented the former deputy. Work in civil servants Jorge Fão, one of the founders of the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFMP) in 1987, noted that Rocha Vieira “fulfilled the mission as governor” and “dignified her country”. The former president of ATFPM, ahead of the association "for over ten years", told Lusa that he was "unionist before being a politician" and "had some mismatches" with the lieutenant general. Fão explained that it was “one of the protagonists” who worked so that, after the transition from Macau to China, “civil servants [of the Portuguese Administration] were entitled to a pension” paid for Portugal. “No employees of the other colonies were entitled (…) when we started talking about discussing the delivery of Macau to China, we were very worried. We ended our trade union struggles and had several meetings with the governance of Portugal and Macau (…). We had some meetings and also in these meetings we had mismatches, ”he recalled. In the end, summarized the current president of the General Assembly of the Association of Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners of Macao, "the outcome was not bad." "Everyone must be satisfied, too, I who had part of this fight and live in this pension for over 30 years," he said. In the passage of administration, there were about 3,600 retirees with pensions transferred to Portugal, he concluded. In 2022, Jorge Fão told Lusa to believe that about two thousand renovated from the former Portuguese administration of Macau were in the Chinese region. PS praises life “entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal” The PS expressed regret for the death of Macao's last Portuguese governor, praising a life “entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal” of a “prestigious military” and one of the “best interpreters of the importance of Macao”. Through a statement, the party led by Pedro Nuno Santos regrets the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, “prestigious military and last governor of Macao under the Portuguese administration”. “His life was entirely dedicated to the service of Portugal, both in his military career and in the political participation after April 25, as a member of the Revolution Council (by inherence of duties as Chief of Staff of the Army), Minister of the Republic in the Azores, assistant secretary of the government of Macao and governor of Macao, ”says the same note. Stating that “his life was forever linked to Macau”, for the PS this “was one of the best interpreters of the importance” of that territory “for the relationship between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China”, as well as the uniqueness of the now region Special Administrative. “The last years of the Portuguese administration of the territory of Macao, under the leadership of General Rocha Vieira, are marked by the realization of several important infrastructural public works to support the subsequent development of Macao, as well as management reforms for its preparation for the preparation for Subsequent period, ”he praises. The socialists also refer to the sovereignty transfer ceremony of the territory of Macao to the Popular Republic of China, in which it was undeniable the way Rocha Vieira "embodied and symbolized dignity and tribute to the Portuguese presence over the centuries in Macao." "And marked the friendship and respect that the Portuguese maintain with Macao and the Popular Republic of China, and which allows, after 25 years of transition, to preserve the uniqueness of Macao that remains a meeting point between cultures," He added. The PS thus gives "public note of its deep respect for services to the country" and "addresses to your family and your friends your most felt condolences." Words of Eanes Already the former President of the Republic Ramalho Eanes classified Rocha Vieira as “a man of exception” and “one of the best” among the greatest figures in Portugal. "General Rocha Vieira was a man of exception for his excellence action and his assumed social responsibility, deserving to be, precisely, considered" one of the best of our greatest, "wrote António Ramalho Eanes in a note sent to Lusa agency. The first head of state elected of Portuguese democracy remembers Vasco Rocha Vieira as "an extraordinary man," especially "at three levels: for his distinctive personality, for his relevant military performance and for the country's services at the country." Personally, Eanes considers that Rocha Vieira, who died today at 85, "had superior qualities", had "exceptional intelligence", "a good temperament" and "had a strong personality." At the military level, “he was one of the most distinct military of his generation, providing the army to the relevant services, in difficult times, namely, in the scent of the political regime prior to April 25, during the 25th of April and even, even, On November 25, having also played an important role as a representative of the Portuguese Armed Forces with NATO ”. Regarding the political level, Eanes concludes that Rocha Vieira had an activity of “great quality and great importance for the country, both as Minister of the Republic for the Azores, either, as governor of Macao, putting all his commitment to design and execution Successfully, a policy of successful Macao transformation, also participating with the successful success, in the transfer of the administration of the territory of Macao to the Popular Republic of China. ” Memories of the Azores The president of the Azorean Parliament, Luís Garcia, also expressed regret for the death of Vasco Rocha Vieira, recalling the “exemplary dedication to the public cause” and the “invaluable contribution” to the country and the Azores. “Throughout his remarkable military and political career, Rocha Vieira has revealed an unshakable sense of state, exemplary dedication to the public cause and a deep patriotism, which indelibly marked the service provided to Portugal,” says Luís Garcia in a note of regret. The President of the Legislative Assembly of the Autonomous Region of the Azores (Alraa) states that he became aware of the death of the Lieutenant General, a "odd figure and one of the most illustrious officers of the Portuguese army", with "deep dismay." According to the note, Luís Garcia "expresses the most felt condolences to the bereaved family, leaving a deep testimony of gratitude for its invaluable contribution to the country and the Azores." "As Minister of the Republic for the Autonomous Region of the Azores, between 1986 and 1991, Vasco Rocha Vieira performed his duties with high commitment, contributing significantly to the strengthening of institutional relations and the valorization of regional autonomy," he says. Alraa's leader also points out that the period when Rocha Vieira was at the service of the Azores "is remembered as a time of dedication to dialogue and the construction of bridges between the national sovereignty organs and the region's own government agencies." “It will also be remembered by the symbolism of his action as the last governor of Macao, a position he held between 1991 and 1999, when he led the transfer of the Portuguese administration to the Chinese, in an example of meaning of responsibility and loyalty to the public service that will be recorded In the collective memory of Portugal ”, he concluded. Portuguese PM manifests itself Prime Minister Luís Montenegro today recalled Rocha Vieira as “one of the most brilliant military personnel to body the patriotic sense of being Portuguese”, highlighting his “historical and striking and macau” connection. Lieutenant General Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao and former army general head of the state, died today at dawn at the age of 85, confirmed to the Portuguese official source of that military industry. “General Vasco Rocha Vieira was one of the brightest military personnel to give body to the patriotic sense of being Portuguese, with special services in the consolidation of our democracy and in the historical and striking connection to Macao, where he was the last governor,” wrote Luís Montenegro, in a publication on the social network X. item.title: Toponymy | Study relates streets with Portuguese names with colonialism
item.description:
In the master's dissertation “Sino-Portuguese Culture in Macau-History on the Streets”, Zhao Zhen argues that the Portuguese administration diluted “the national identity” of the Chinese population, by putting names with reference to Portugal on the streets, namely writers, navigators, governors and civil servants
Zhao Zhen, author of the master's dissertation “Sino-Portuguese Culture in Macao-Street History and Sino-Portuguese Culture from the perspective of the names of the streets of Macau)”, argues that the choice of street names with reference to Portugal during Portugal The years of the Portuguese administration was an effective form of colonization and the creation of the feeling of belonging to the colonizing nation, especially with regard to the Chinese community. In the dissertation, defended at the University of Trás-os-Montes and Alto Douro (UTAD), it is concluded that “before the return of Macau to China the Portuguese government carried out a political and cultural practice through the attribution of street names to Portuguese way ”. Thus, the names of the streets of Macao served “as a means of transmitting a collective memory, starting with the construction of the Portuguese government's image in Macau and the guidance of its main values”, using “iconic historical figures and events to reinforce the identification of the colonized with their colonizing identity ”. Zhao Zhen also added that “during the 400 years of the colonization of Macau by the Portuguese state, linguistic symbols were applied to the inhabitants of Macao by appointing the streets, diluting the traditional national identity of the Chinese and implanting that of the colonizers, thus reaching the objective of remodeling the national identity of local inhabitants ”. For the author of the study, the issue of very particular toponymy of the territory brought consequences with regard to national identity. “The names of the streets of Macao are different from those of other Chinese cities, and this has impacted the cultural identity of the local population, which grew up with Chinese and Portuguese history and culture and has no strong sense of cultural identity. Thus dilutes its mission to convey its national culture. ” A form of domain Admittedly, Zhao Zhen's academic work in the area of ​​Culture Sciences draws attention to the fact that Macau's toponymy reflects a mixture of cultures. However, the author goes further, analyzing how many streets there are in Portuguese and Chinese with names of important personalities, highlighting the fact that Portuguese culture is dominant. The fact that they exist in Macau streets with names of military, former governors or Portuguese politicians, such as Mario Soares, Sidónio Pais or Ramalho Eanes, is pointed out as synonymous that the Portuguese bet “in an effective process” of transmitting “a materialized vision” of the world that influences and transmits social relations between people and different social classes ”. Thus, what happened was “an act that does not use violence as a form of forced control of minds and population awareness”, in which “a means of coercion” was not applied. Zhao Zhen states that "in total there are 26 streets named after Portuguese government officials in Macao who were distinguished by the contribution they made to the city, with no street with the name of a Chinese employee in Macao." This shows “the distinction made by the Portuguese colonizers as a ruling class and the Chinese as a dominated class” is indicated. However, the author points out that “the Portuguese colonization of Macau was not an absolute aggression or rule”, because “the colonizers tried to achieve leadership from a variety of perspectives, including ideological”, in which “the process of achieving this leadership It was interspersed with a more complex racial and cultural existence. ” According to the author, “the first systematic delimitation of streets and the establishment of names by the Portuguese government of Macao was in 1869”, and were used enough names with connection to the discoveries and the former Portuguese empire. Zhao Zhen sets the example of João de Almeida Street, which "is named after a general who stood out in the affirmation campaigns of colonial power in Angola, Africa, in the early twentieth century." In total, there are 26 streets with references to the discoveries and former Portuguese navigators, showing that “the colonial administration [Portuguese] used external political forces to indoctrinate the inhabitants of Macao with the intention of achieving leadership, guiding society through manipulation spiritual, moral and cultural ”. In addition, the author considers that it was used "a colonial vocabulary to create a sense of identity and subordination among the inhabitants, in order to achieve permanent colonization." Highlight for the existence of nine streets in Macau under the name of Macaenses, as is the case of Francisco H. Fernandes Street, who was born in the territory on February 13, 1863, son of Portuguese parents, and was close friend of Sun Yat -The father of the Republican Revolution in China in 1911. The place of the Chinese In the same dissertation it is read that, in contrast to the primacy of references to Portuguese culture and history, there are only 12 streets in Macau “with the name of Chinese”, most of which were “were the peninsula merchants and all had connections with the Portuguese government of the region ”. In turn, "Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Avenue is the only street with the name of a Chinese political figure." Citing another academic, nicknamed Kuan, Zhao Zhen states that "in the case of names with names of Chinese celebrities, besides being inferior in number, they were non -political figures." "The Portuguese government of Macao, when it baptized the public roads, was intentionally into account political factors, wanting to convey the message that Macau was under Portuguese rule and that, politically speaking, was a Portuguese colony," said this same academic. Highlight for two streets appointed after the return of Macao to China, namely Doctor Henry Fok Avenue and Doctor Ma Man Kei Avenue. “These personalities were distinguished by the remarkable contributions to the reunification of Hong Kong and Macau and to the development of China, so the attribution of the street name to these personalities reflects the influence of political factors after the end of Macau's long colonial history and soft reunification with China. The addition of the word 'doctor' to their names shows even more respect for them, ”reads. Also noteworthy is 140 streets in Macao whose names are phonetically translated from Chinese, highlighting the Avenida de IP Heng, Avenida de Lok Koi, Patio de Iong Loc, Patio Fu Van or Rua de San Lei. “All these words Chinese express the desire of the people in a better life and the demand for quality of life. Other nominations are related to the Chinese religion, such as the Largo de Pao Cong Mio, Rua de Kun Iam Tong, ”is referred to, not forgetting the 69 streets with paraphrased names in Chinese -connected Chinese beliefs. “In order to live a better life and to forward it in the expected direction, the naming of the streets reflects geographical elements, as well as people's hopes for their future lives. The names of the streets are mentioned and used so often that people tend to give them good meanings to satisfy their own intentions of a better life. Influenced by traditional Chinese cultural concepts, many of the street names in Macau have auspicious and lucky meanings, with the words 'harmony, tranquility, friendship, benevolence, concordia'. ” There are also streets whose names "show traders' desire to have a prosperous business and to get all the profits that come from business." In general terms, Zhao Zhen concludes that “Macau's experience proves the possibility of harmonious coexistence of various communities and cultures”, and the toponymy “reflects the coexistence and mix of the East and the West, the harmony and difference between them, which Today is a mirror of culture and fundamental values ​​of society. ”

item.title: USA | Trump takes office and throws barbs to China on Panama Canal
item.description: The new US President Donald Trump promised Monday to take control of the Panama Canal, renamed the Gulf of Mexico and reinforce the taxation of foreign countries, confirming intentions already expressed for the second term in the White House. In his speech at the inauguration ceremony as 47th President of the United States Donald Trump stressed that the purpose of the agreement and the spirit of the treaty in relation to the Panama Canal “were fully violated”, promising to take control of this vital maritime infrastructure to global trade. “And most importantly, China operates the Panama Canal, and we didn't give it to China, we gave Panama. And let's take it back, ”he justified in his speech held at the Capitol (headquarters of the US Congress) in Washington. In another intention already expressed, Trump also confirmed that soon he will change the name of Mexico's Gulf to “Gulf of America”. More taxes On his return to the White House (US presidency), after a first term between 2017 and 2021, the Republican politician also said he intends to reinforce the taxation of foreign countries in favor of US citizens. “I will immediately begin to reform our commercial system to protect families and US workers. Instead of taxing our citizens to enrich other countries, we will impose rates and taxes on foreign countries to enrich our citizens, ”he said. Expel illegal Donald Trump also assured that he will expel “millions and millions” of illegal immigrants, one of the main focuses of his election campaign. "First, I will declare the state of emergency in our southern border," with Mexico, said the president, adding that he will send the army to patrol this region. "All illegal entrances will be immediately blocked and we will begin the process of return millions and millions of criminals where they came," added the Republican President. The oath of the new US leader was carried out shortly after his future vice-president, JD Vance, with which he led the republican party's appointment, which, on November 5, 2024, won the presidential election against the candidacy Democrat headed by Kamala Harris. The ceremony in Washington took place at 5 pm, Lisbon time (dawn in Macao) and was marked by the presence of populist and far-right international politicians, but with scarce government officials and without leaders of the European Union (EU), except the first -Menial Italian minister, Giorgia Meloni.

item.title: Oxfam | Report says that rich fortunes have increased by 2024
item.description:
A report released yesterday by Oxfam indicates that the richest fortunes in the world increased two billions of dollars last year, equivalent to $ 5.7 billion a day. The non -governmental organization suggests measures that favor equality and alert to the risks of the concentration of wealth and power
It's called “Takers Not Makers-The Unjust Poverty and Unearned Wealth of Coloniaism” [those who receive and don't create-unfair poverty and unmeasured richness of colonialism] and is the latest Oxfam report, non-governmental organization (NGO ) which brings together 19 countries. The document draws attention to poverty in the world and inequalities in the distribution of wealth. The report released yesterday concludes that inequality gives no signs of slowing down. This is because, last year, the combined wealth of global multimillionaires increased two billion dollars, equivalent to $ 5.7 billion a day, according to Oxfam. This means that it grew at a pace three times higher than the previous year, according to the NGO. This was the main conclusion of the report released yesterday at the beginning of the Davos World Economic Forum, which each year brings together the world's leading political and economic leaders in the Alpina city. In the last year alone, the report reports, an average of almost four new multimillionaires a week came, as Oxfam puts in contrast to the World Bank poverty data, which estimates that the number of people living with less than 6.85 Dollars a day has almost not changed since 1990. In 2024, there were 2,769 multimillionaires worldwide, instead of 2,565 the previous year, and its combined wealth increased from 13 to 15 billions of dollars in just 12 months. It is the second largest increase in the combined wealth of multimillionaires in a single year since there is a record. 100 million plus 100 million The joint wealth of the ten richest men in the world increased, on average, almost $ 100 million a day, the study indicates. Even if they lost 99 percent of their richness overnight, "they would remain multimillionaires." The NGO predicts that, in less than a decade, the first "billionaire" of the planet arises and does not exclude the possibility that there are at least five. Worldwide, the report reveals that 36 percent of the wealth of the richest is inherited and 61 percent is also marked by clientelism and/or linked to monopolistic power. Oxfam is based on Forbes magazine's 'wealth ranking' data, which show that all multimillionaires under 30 inherited their wealth and, according to Swiss bank UBS data, in the next 20 to 30 years, a thousand dos Current multimillionaires will leave their heirs more than $ 5.2 billion. Southern money For Oxfam, the system "makes large flows of money from the global south to the north, benefit the richest population," in a kind of "modern colonialism." In 2023 alone, through the Financial System, $ 30 million will be removed per hour from the global southern countries to the richest 1 percent of the global northern countries, such as the United Kingdom, the United States and France. Thus, the “super rich” of the global northern countries control 69 percent of world wealth, concentrate 77 percent of the joint richness of all multimillionaires and represent about 68 percent of the total, although they constitute only 21 percent of World population. To contextualize this inequality, Oxfam refers to the problem of housing in Spain and estimates that "the five future billionaires on the planet will have so much money that they can buy all the country's houses." In contrast, attention is drawn to the fact that the “working class fights to survive.” "Those who live in poverty around the world continue to face multiple crises, as pandemic scars are still with us in the form of priceless debt, lower salaries, and much higher food prices." In addition, “conflicts are also increasing, which contributes to poverty, hunger and inequality”, without forgetting “the enormous human impact of climate degradation that increases every year, with deaths caused by excessive heat, extreme weather conditions and hunger". Oxfam even says that Donald Trump's reelection as president of the United States last November "has given a huge momentum to the billionaires' fortunes, while his policies are prepared to further stir the flames of inequality." The NGO also highlights the World Bank data in its latest poverty report, where it is said that "if the current growth rates remain and inequality does not decrease, it will take more than a century to end poverty." The document shows that "if we reduce inequality, poverty could be eliminated three times faster." One of the highlights goes to the contribution of women to the wealth of the few. “Racialized women living in poverty, especially those in the 'global south', continue to subsidize the global economy. It is estimated that every day women contribute 12.5 billion of unpaid work hours, adding at least 10.8 trilions of dollars in the global economy. ” In this context, “the economic contribution of its care work is three times higher than the financial value of the world technological industry”. A new colonialism Admittedly, the decolonization of regions colonized by European powers began to occur more strongly from the Bandung Conference in 1955, but signs of power imbalance between peoples and countries that explain, partly, the inequality of wealth that occurs in part explain today. The idea of ​​new colonialism, in the sense that regions such as Europe or North America continue to explore southern countries, especially the least developed, is well patent in the Oxfam report. “The rise of a new oligarchy in which inheritance, clientelism and monopoly power generate extreme wealth. Without control, we are about to see the greatest transfer of the greatest generational wealth in human history, hardly earned, hardly taxed. ” What happens today is an overview of "billionaire colonialism," describes Oxfam, with the "transfer of wealth not only to ultra-rich but disproportionately to global northern ultrascourse." There is a "reckoning with colonialism not only as a history of brutal extraction of wealth, but also as a powerful force that leads to extreme levels of inequality today." Oxfam also draws attention to a new wave of colonialism evidence in the actions of the major economic and financial institutions that decide the direction of the global economy, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the United Nations (UN) and the World Bank. "Global institutions, financial markets, and multinational companies, all shaped by colonialism and mastery of rich countries, continue to facilitate the south-north transfer of dollar trillion every year." For Oxfam, the UN, IMF and World Bank "were created 80 years ago, near the end of the historical colonial period, and its unequal governance has had little changed since then." “G7 countries continue to stop 41 percent of the vows in the World Bank and are less than ten percent of the world's population. World Bank and IMF leaders continue to be decided by the United States and Europe, respectively. Likewise, European countries and other global nations have 47 percent of the total seats on the UN Security Council, although they represent only 17 percent of the world's population. ” It should be noted that "the IMF and the World Bank continue to have a huge influence on the global economic system and, in particular, on the economic policies of low and medium-low countries." These entities, according to Oxfam, "systematically insist on the implementation of cuts in critical expenses." One of the examples presented is from the IMF, which "requires debtor countries to prioritize the payment of debts to creditors above all and implement policies that include privatization, liberalization of trade and reduction of public deficits to obtain new loans." "These policies impair access to quality education and affordable prices and health care, with a negative impact on public health," he adds. What to do? Oxfam proposes a series of measures to mitigate the growing inequality between the richest and the rest of the planet, suggesting, among others, that governments commit to ensuring that the yield of the ten percent of the population will not exceed the 40 Poor percent, both national and world level. The report also establishes an increase in taxes on large fortunes, through an international tax system designed by the UN, and the elimination of tax havens. Lame

item.title: Portugal | Rocha Vieira “decisive” for democracy
item.description:
The Assembly of the Republic unanimously approved a vote of regret proposed by José Pedro Aguiar-Branco, in which Rocha Vieira is considered a relevant personality in the construction of Portuguese democracy
The Parliament of Portugal unanimously approved a vote of regret of the Assembly of the Republic by the death of General Rocha Vieira, former governor of Macau, considered a relevant personality in the construction of Portuguese democracy. Minister of the Republic in the Azores between 1986 and 1991, governor of Macao between 1991 and 1999, during the period of the transfer of sovereignty of this territory to China, General Vasco Rocha Vieira, born in Lagoa, died on Wednesday at the age of 85. In the vote subscribed by José Pedro Aguiar-Branco, it refers that Rocha Vieira performed functions as head of the army state between 1976 and 1978 and integrated, in care, the Council of Revolution, being a “decisive figure of political life and Portuguese military ”. “His military career also included services in Angola and Macao, where he was chief of staff of the Independent Territorial Command and Deputy Secretary for Public Works during the transition to democracy. Degree in Civil Engineering, it accumulated several military and civil awards, including the Great Cross of the Military Order of the Tower and Sword. He was also a chancellor of the Council of the Old Military Orders, between 2006 and 2016 ”, reads in the text proposed by the President of the Assembly of the Republic.
“Iconic image” José Pedro Aguiar-Branco considers later that “the Portuguese recall the iconic image of General Rocha Vieira, at the Macao Administration Transfer ceremony, holding the Portuguese flag”. “They also recognize their high testimony of service, patriotism and civic dedication. The Assembly of the Republic (…) expresses its deep regret for the death of General Vasco Rocha Vieira and pays tribute to this prominent Portuguese army officer, so relevant in the construction of our democracy, ”he adds. In his career in the Armed Forces, Rocha Vieira was also a national military representative at the Supreme Headquarters of NATO's allied powers in Europe-Shape, Belgium, and Honorary Director of Arms and Engineering. He was an honorary associate of the Lisbon Geography Society, the Historical Society of Independence of Portugal and the Combatants League, and was appointed a member of the EDP General and Supervision Council in 2012. Funeral funeral funerals took place on Friday, as well as the celebration of a present body mass and a procession that followed Lisbon to Algarve, where a new Mass was celebrated in the Mother Church of Lagoa. The funeral was held at the Lagoa Cemetery, and the City Council decreed three days of municipal mourning.

item.title: Contests | Deputies discussed “competitive negotiation”
item.description: The possibility of representatives of the Public Administration to negotiate directly the proposals of public tenders with the candidates was discussed yesterday in the 1st Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly. This news will be created by the public hiring proposal, approved in general on January 11 last year. According to the explanations of Ella Law, chairman of the Commission, the possibility of the so -called “competitive negotiation” with candidates is a novelty of the law, but can only be used in three situations: when all public tender proposals are refused, although without amending Substantially the contest charges book, when the work is too complex, which makes it impracticable to establish a previous price for the proposals, or when the nature of the works make it impossible to set the prior fixation of a price. According to the newspaper or Mun, the law proposal states that when the administration chooses to avoid the public tender, and calls for proposals to a certain number of companies, the consultation must be made at least five companies. However, Ella Law indicated that the deputies are concerned that the alleged “randomness” of the companies consulted is not guaranteed or result in a fair procedure, so this will be discussed with the executive.

item.title: Press | Sam Hou Fai stresses diversity and internationalization
item.description:
The message was left by the chief executive during the dinner offered to the media in Portuguese and English. Sam Hou Fai highlighted the connecting link established with the international community
The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, considered that the Portuguese and English Language Communication bodies play a link in connection with the international community. The message was left during the traditional dinner offered to the media. According to the Social Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai stated that “Portuguese and English language media is an important example of Macao's cultural diversity and internationalization”. The government leader said they hoped these bodies “also proceed with the good performance of the international link, enhancing the advantages of linguistic, cultural and international ties, continuing to exterior to Macao's uniqueness, resulting from the fusion of oriental and western cultures. ”. With this hope, the government leader believes that the media bodies contribute to "raising the role of Macao as a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, as well as a higher -level opening platform." item.title: Continental Council of Affairs warns “possible risks” in Macau
item.description: Taiwan recommended to the population not to travel to Hong Kong or Macau during the Lunar New Year, due to "possible risks to safety." The Continental Council of Affairs (MAC) of Taiwan recalled that the travel alert to both territories remains at the “orange level”, the second highest level. The agency responsible for relations with China justifies the warning "taking into account the changes to the situation in Hong Kong and Macau and in response to local laws and regulations and methods of application of laws." "Citizens are advised to avoid non -essential trips" to both cities, including in transit, due to "possible risks to safety and individual rights," added the MAC in a statement. The Lunar New Year is the main party of Chinese families, equivalent to Christmas in Western countries, and this year in Taiwan includes a period of nine days of holidays between January 25 and February 2. MAC advised the population in advance in a database created for Taiwanese inland, Hong Kong or Macao and recalled that there are direct telephone lines to support citizens. Registers to rise Although not mandatory, the number of Taiwanese who registered travel to Chinese territory between January and October 2024 increased about 14 times compared to the previous year, according to data released by the body in December. The records for Hong Kong and Macao “exceeded five times the total of the same period last year,” said the MAC. China "continued to adopt and change national security laws, which led to several incidents, involving arbitrary detention, arrest and interrogation of Taiwanese citizens in mainland China, Hong Kong and Macao," said the body. In September, MAC said a Taiwanese conglomerate leader Formosa Plastics had been under "border control" for 18 days, a type of measure that prevents him from leaving the country. Taiwan raised in mid -June the travel alert level and advised the population to avoid China, Hong Kong and Macau, after Beijing threatened to execute people considered “defendant turns” of Taiwanese independence.

item.title: Watch out for the bags
item.description:
“Look at the suitcase…” was a song by fadista Celeste Rodrigues. It became immensely popular. I remembered the song because last week the bags were the main theme of the media. We all have a suitcase. Most people traveling by plane have a basement suitcase where you introduce the most varied belongings. Usually we put the clothes, shoes, hygiene products and memories to family and friends inside. There are many ladies who do not realize the risk put some of their valuable jewelry in their travels. There are people who risk transporting amounts of money curled on silver paper. And there is drug trafficking in many of the basement bags with the most diverse disguises. The suitcase is fundamental as something very intimate and accompanying us. Many times the suitcase does not reach the destination and we have to expect several days that appear and there are also cases where some of the bags never see each other again. Airlines are required, in these cases, to compensate passengers who have run out of bags. However, the products that belonged to us and that we liked a lot never see them again. This happens around the world and almost every day in the most different airports. The suitcase in the airport carpet is completely identified by itself, due to its color and even the accessory linked to the handle with our name and our phone. By the way, I remembered a text by writer Yvette Vieira, who said: “I recently read news about an English tourist who threw herself to the sea on Madeira Island, allegedly to go after a cruise ship where she would be The husband, the wife was rescued from the sea waters by three young people who decided to go to fishing that same night and one of the details that caught my attention throughout this Rocambolesque story was that the lady in question was able to maintain the surface in cold waters of the Atlantic, thanks to its suitcase. And that last fact did not surprise me, because it is under what circumstances is a woman never drops her suitcase. Which leads me to the theme I want to explore, women and their bags. In this world there are two types of portfolios, those who use large bags and women who prefer small sizes. I belong to the first group, because my whole life is concentrated in my suitcase. I am that kind of woman who in an emergency can get out of her suitcase, as if it was a magician's top hat, all kinds of things, from fast stakes, ointments, paper to write, water, headache, etc, etc. , think about what is and probably this object is contained in the content of my suitcase. Moreover, I have a friend who owned among her personal belongings a screwdriver that had been forgotten in the suitcase and accompanied her for almost a year. And I'm not playing! Not to mention the bags of moms that are true warehouses of paraphernalia that would leave you dropped. But why does a woman feel need to have everything in her wallet? I don't know. I would like to have a logical explanation for such an almost insane behavior, which implies pounds of belongings transported daily with long -term consequences for our bone structure, in my case I can only say that I do not like being caught off guard. ” For the case is really, not being caught off guard. We don't run out of a suitcase where we are like that we like very much and that we are particularly disliked if we lose them. It turned out that the news fell like a bomb about the theft allegedly practiced by a party deputy arrives. The same party that does not stop talking about crime and that criminals must all be arrested. For, the Azorian deputy of the arrival was under the eye of the authorities since November last year, due to an anonymous complaint, that he stole bags that did not belong to him from the rugs of the airports of Lisbon and Ponta Delgada. Authorities this time confirmed through video-vigilance images that the deputy took bags that allegedly did not belong to him. Searches were searched for their Lisbon and Azores homes, resulting in suspicion of even stealing bags from other passengers. It sounds like a caricature case, but it is not. According to the television commentator and lawyer Rogério Alves, if proving the robbery of suitcases will be a serious crime that can go to a sentence of eight years in prison. However, the deputy concerned Miguel Arruda, after being removed from arrival, shamefully decided to continue in Parliament as an unregistered deputy. Just imagine the disappearance of your plane holding suitcase. The loss of your belongings, the consequent disgust, and even the damage caused by a mental tare of someone who got used to pants from others and enjoying everything good that these bags would have inside. Now, the act is committed by a deputy of the Assembly of the Republic is that even the devil would not imagine being possible. Final investigations are awaited and the last court decision on the alleged robberies of the arrival of the arrival. Most importantly, reader friends be careful with your bags…

item.title: What way to go?
item.description: At the end of last year, during the visit to Macau, to chair the inauguration of the new Chief Executive and to inspect Rae, President XI Jinping gave two speeches, highlighting the "three expectations" and the "four hopes" to Macao's future development.
