item.title: Geogogogosronomy and Macau Creative City in UNESCO Gastronomy
item.description: “Geogostronomy Offers an Innovative Lens Through The Exploration of the Deep-Rooted Cultural Connections Between Food, Landscape and People. The Synergy of the Mix and Match From Different Areas Creates A Magical Creativity to Outstand the Taste of Memories Which Seated as the Greatest Piece of a Region. As part of the UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy in Macao, Lisbon Macau Aim to Bring Together the Tradition and Innovation of Food and Fun Places to Foster the Global Appreciation of Macao. ” Dr. Christine Hong Barbosa. Vice President of Marketing & Retail Development of Lisboeta Geogostronomy is a term that fuses geography and gastronomy, emphasizing the relationship between food culture and its geographical roots. This concept highlights the way local ingredients, cooking methods and cultural influences converge to shape regional kitchens. By examining local gastronomy, researchers and enthusiasts can get information about the history, culture and identity of a community. Geogostronomy thus serves as a bridge that connects culinary practices to environmental and sociopolitical contexts. Macao, located on the southern coast of China, is a distinct example of geogostronomy in action. Its position as a Historical Trade Port and Culture Cauldron provides a unique scenario for its culinary evolution. The intricate mix of Portuguese and Chinese influences in Macanese cuisine shows how geography can influence food culture, leading to a diversified range of flavors, ingredients and cooking techniques. Macau's gastronomic scene is a vibrant tapestry woven from various cultural wires, particularly those of Chinese and Portuguese origin. The city has iconic dishes such as the Macaense curry, cod and the authentic cream pastels (which are not confused with the eggs that ask for the streets and that we will reveal how such a phenomenon), each reflecting its influences arose. unique historicals. The fusion of spices, aromatic herbs and kitchen styles creates a distinct gastronomic identity. The use of seasonal and local ingredients enhances Macau's connection to its geographical environment, reinforcing the principles of geogostronomy. The historical context of Macau's gastronomy is remarkable. Portuguese colonization introduced new ingredients and culinary techniques that were part of Chinese food traditions. This cultural exchange has resulted in a rich variety of dishes that combine the best of both worlds. For example, the use of cumin, curry powder and coconut milk reflects Portuguese culinary practices, while techniques such as WOK frying means traditional Chinese cuisine methods. As a result, Macao's cuisine developed in a sophisticated mixture rather than a mere amalgam of the influences that influence it. Several influential personalities play a crucial role in the formation of Macau's culinary scene. Notable chefs and restorers devoted their efforts to the preservation and innovation of Macanese cuisine. The renowned heads António Neves Coelho and José Avillez are known to modernize the traditional Portuguese dishes, maintaining their authenticity. Your approach serves as an example of how bosses can honor their culinary inheritance, adapting to contemporary trends. They emphasize the use of local ingredients and the appreciation of traditional recipes. Through their initiatives, they promote the concept of geogostronomy as a method for preserving culinary heritage. His work exemplifies the vital role that cooking chiefs and cooking professionals play in the creative city. The designation of “Macau as a Creative City in Gastronomy of UNESCO” in 2017 further enhances the importance of culinary innovation and heritage. This recognition emphasizes the city's commitment to maintain and promote its rich culinary history, while promoting a sustainable future. The program encourages collaboration between local chiefs, artisans and academics, promoting a culture of gastronomy that reflects Macao's mixed identity. The designation of “Macao as UNESCO's Creative City” had a great impact on various facets of the Macanese society, namely in tourism and the local economies that slowed during the time of the Covid-19 pandemic and begins to be reborn. Lisbon Macao, for example, has contributed remarkablely being its official view of “being an macao thematic tourist destination, which combines iconic milestones of its collective memory, with unique sino-Portuguese culture to promote its unique cultural identity . Lisbon Macao is proudly aligns with Macau's vision as a creative city of UNESCO's cuisine. The rich cultural history of Macau, which combines Portuguese and Chinese influences, creates a unique and dynamic gastronomic landscape. Lisbon Macau believes that this recognition as a creative city of UNESCO's gastronomy not only celebrates the fusion of flavors and traditions, but also highlights the importance of preserving and innovating local food heritage. With a strong commitment to preserving the Macaense heritage and the promotion of innovative culinary experiences, Lisboeta Macau takes advantage of the company's strengths to promote Macaense-Portuguese culture, supporting the transf by “tourism+gastronomy” through collaboration with the famous boss Portuguese António Coelho in “Angela's Café and Lounge”, highlighting the fusion of Macau's Luso-Chinese heritage with Portuguese traditional cuisine, combining Portuguese classic culinary techniques with innovative creations to offer citizens and visitors a memorable gastronomic experience and contributing to the growing Macao reputation as a vibrant gastronomic center, aligned with its economic development, attracting food enthusiasts, tourists and industry professionals. ” “Lisbon Macao is committed to supporting the Mashely Government strategy to promote the tourism industry, consistently boosting local economic growth through innovation and transionic integration. Lisbon Line Friends Themed Restaurant Macau “Brown & Friends Cafe & Bistro” and the famous “Cejerdy” crab brand joined the 24th Macao Gastronomic Festival, presenting the various local flavors to global tourists and highlighting them Macao dynamic strengths as a vibrant platform as a creative city of gastronomy from UNESCO. In addition, Lisbon Macau aims to take advantage of the synergies of the “Macao Outdoor Show Space” to present the “Lisbon Night-The Night Market with Macaenses”, encouraging the economic development of the community and immersing visitors in a distinct mixture of Traditional culture and modern innovation, showing the essence of the culture of macaense and Portuguese inspiration, further reinforcing the night economy of Macao. These collaborations help reinforce Macau's position as a creative city that values ​​both culinary tradition and innovation, ensuring long -term sustainability of its gastronomic scene, while promoting economic growth and cultural exchange. ” Such a distinction, he positioned Macau as a global gastronomic destination, attracting gastronomy enthusiasts and tourists eager for experiencing his unique culinary offers. The tourism sector benefited significantly with this designation. With the increase in international interest in the gastronomy of Macao, several festivals and gastronomic events were organized to present local dishes. These events not only celebrate gastronomic culture, but also offer entrepreneurs and platform companies to show their products. This increase in tourism translates into an increase in economic opportunities for local inhabitants, including the creation of employment in the sectors of hospitality, restoration and homemade food production or almost, weigh the crisis that Macau lives with the low purchasing power of residents that It decreased to the detriment of the continent and the tourist from there that it has reduced equally for the same reasons. In addition, UNESCO's designation leads the government to sponsor initiatives designed to support sustainable practices in the gastronomy sector. Programs that encourage cuisine without waste demonstrate a commitment to sustainability and community involvement. This paradigm change reflects a growing awareness of the interconnections between gastronomy, environmental management and social responsibility. Culinary education is another critical aspect of Macau's gastronomic narrative. Teaching institutions and cooking schools that should be created urgently not only reserved for the University of Tourism will play a key role in the formation of the next generation of bosses and cooking professionals. As they integrate the traditional Macanese cuisine in their curricula, these institutions foster the appreciation of the local gastronomic culture among students. This educational approach also encourages innovation, as young bosses experiment with their heritage, giving new life to traditional recipes. Cultural preservation is critical to maintaining the rich culinary history of Macau. Initiatives designed to document traditional recipes and cooking techniques through oral stories and publications ensure the safeguarding of these culinary traditions for future generations. The role of grassroots organizations and community projects centered on culinary heritage reflects the collaborative spirit of geogostronomy, in which local communities actively strive to preserve their unique food crops. Despite the positive impacts of its designation by UNESCO, Macau's gastronomic sector faces challenges that deserve attention. A significant concern is the potential dilution of traditional practices due to globalization and mass tourism. With the proliferation of international restaurants and fast food chains, there is a risk that local culinary traditions are overshadowed, leading to a loss of cultural identity. In addition, Covid-19 pandemic had a serious impact on the sectors of hotel and tourism. Travel and restoration restrictions have forced many local companies to adapt quickly or risk closing. Although some establishments have adopted innovative approaches, such as delivery services and virtual cooking classes, others have struggled to survive in a difficult economic scenario. Another challenge lies in the balance between modernization and culinary authenticity. As heads experience melting kitchens and modern kitchen techniques, concerns may arise regarding the integrity of traditional dishes. Finding a balance between innovation and preservation will be essential to maintain the authenticity of Macanese cuisine. Looking to the future, several developments may emerge in the macao gastronomy sector. One of the predictable trends is the growing emphasis on sustainable practices. As consumers become increasingly aware of the environmental impact of their eating choices, Macao's restaurants and the likes can give priority to local and organic supply. This change promotes a sense of community and responsibility to the environment. In addition, technology is likely to remodel the culinary landscape. Advances in food production, preservation and distribution can provide growth and innovation opportunities. For example, using digital platforms can improve marketing efforts and reinforce connections between consumers and local producers. Innovations such as vertical agriculture and aquaponia can also offer sustainable solutions to supply ingredients in a densely populated city. Collaboration between cooking professionals, tourist authorities, and macao governments and the provinces of the continent will play a crucial role in defining the evolution of Macao's gastronomic identity. Joint initiatives to promote food culture, organize workshops and present local ingredients can raise the profile of Macanese cuisine on the global stage. These collaboration efforts promote community involvement and can mitigate the risks placed by globalization and pandemic. The future of Macao's cuisine seems promising, with an increasing emphasis on sustainability and innovation. The spirit of collaboration of geogogogosronomy can guide the city in the navigation of these challenges, ensuring that its rich culinary heritage lasts as it adapts to a change world.

item.title: Crafts | Exhibition and workshops show Gizhou and Hebei goldsmiths
item.description:
“Brightness of Art - Gold and Silver Handicraft Exhibition of Hebei and Guizhou provinces” is the name of the Patent Show in the TAP Seac Gallery that displays artisanal goldsmiths of the Chinese provinces. In addition to the more than 160 pieces of gold and silver, the Cultural Institute challenges the public to know the craft practices of working the precious metals in workshops
The TAP Seac Gallery will show until February 23rd “Brightness of Art - Gold and Silver Craft Exhibition of the Provinces of Hebei and Guizhou”, a show that presents to Macao public to goldsmiths and traditional handicrafts of the two Chinese provinces and the ancestral form of working gold and silver. Organized by the Cultural Institute, the exhibition is part of the Serpent Lunar New Year's celebration series, presenting “more than 160 pieces and joint joints and exquisite gold and silver articles”. The works “present sophisticated formats, a very high degree of technical refinement and a variety of styles. Inheriting traditional longtime techniques and incorporating a modern aesthetics, traditional arts radiate a contemporary aura, ”the IC describes in a statement. As the name of the exhibition implies, the pieces are a reflection of the art -embedded art and Chinese art in Cloisonné (technique of application of thin gold strips on metal surfaces, usually bronze) of Hebei province. The exhibition also presents the goldsmith of the Miao ethnic group of the province of Guizhou. Both cultural manifestations are in the national list of representative items of China's intangible cultural heritage.
Cultural preciousness The art of creating gold and silver pieces is a type of traditional Chinese crafts with over 3000 years of history. The IC indicates that the pieces of the art embedded in Filigree and Chinese art in Cloisonné de Hebei are characterized by a high degree of technical refinement, the diversity of their motives and their stunning ornamentation, having a great artistic value. In turn, the goldsmiths of the ethnic group Miao de Guizhou, denotes a multiplicity of cultural connotations, giving rise to works of markedly ethnic style, of excellent artistic taste. The Miao ethnic group is one of the largest in the interior of China, encompassing about 56 dialects and ethnicities. Miao live mainly in the mountainous regions of southern China. In addition to the province of Guizhou, the ethnic group is set in areas in the provinces of Yunnan, Sichuan, Hubei, Hunan, Guangxi, Haião and even Guangdong. Guided tours will also be made available to the exhibition on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays, with the Sessions in Cantonense scheduled for 15h and Mandarin for 4:15 pm.

On February 8th, from 10am to 12pm and from 15h to 17h, an instructor will present art techniques inhaled in Hebei Filigrana. item.title: Consumption | Casinos at the mercy of Chinese real estate and trust
item.description:
During the lunar year of the serpent casinos revenues will increase, but growth level divides analysts. The recovery of real estate and consumer confidence levels in the interior of China will be determining factors
Casinos' revenues can grow up to 7 percent in the lunar year of the serpent, depending on the recovery of the Chinese real estate and confidence, but they will be away from the pre-pound peak, analysts told Lusa. "The biggest positive factor for Macao would be if the Chinese economy grew and consumer confidence levels improve," said Vitaly Umnsky, analyst at the Seaport Research Partners consultancy company. More than 70 percent of the people who visited the territory in 2024 came from mainland China, whose economic growth reached in 2024 the goal of 5 percent fixed by Beijing. But Nicholas Chenist, Creditsights analyst, said the company of the Financial Notation Agency group Fitch expects a 4.7 percent slowdown this year, in part due to weak private consumption. The consumer confidence index in China fell in September to the lowest level of the last 34 years, stressed Jeffrey Kiang, analyst at Consultant CLSA. That is, "if the prospects for Chinese consumers are not good, they will be able to tighten their belt, reduce travel and consumption," including Macao, Nicholas Chen explained.
Stimulus policies The Chinese Communist Party has launched a series of stimulus measures, including the reduction of interest rates and mandatory bank reserves and the anticipation of thousands of millions of its budget in 2025 to fund construction projects. Beijing also widened a consumer goods exchange system and increased the salaries of millions of civil servants to revive internal demand. "The [Chinese] government has said it will launch more measures to stimulate the economy," said Vitaly Umansky, who expects mainly a recovery of the middle class confidence: "I think it will happen, it's just a matter of time." Creditsights expects Chinese consumer confidence to rise in the second half of 2025, along with real estate price stabilization, which have been falling for 19 consecutive months. The issue concerns a lot of Beijing, due to the implications for social stability, since housing is one of the main investment vehicles of families and the real estate sector - adding indirect factors - represents about 30 percent of the Chinese economy. "There will certainly be some side effect, because part of the measures that are adopted to boost domestic consumption may flow to the Macao game sector," said Nicholas Chen. The analyst believes that China will still widen the list of cities whose residents can ask for 'individual visas' to visit Hong Kong and Macau, a method used by 35.2 percent of tourists who passed by Macao in 2024.
Different views Vitaly Umansky has no opinion and recalls that since January 1 residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay up to seven days. On the other hand, analysts agree that casino revenues will be next year away from the maximum historical 303 billion patacas recorded in 2018. "One thing is clear: the government aims to moderately growth in revenues in the future," said Jeffrey Kiang, recalling authorities predict gaming revenues of 240 billion in 2025, which would be a 5.8 percent increase. . “When the Macao government publishes a forecast, it is usually very conservative and is based on a prior discussion with the Chinese central government's connection case in the city, Vitaly Umnsky said. The analyst does not believe that Beijing has some measure to control the resuming of casinos, similar to the campaign that began with the arrest of the leader of the world's largest VIP betting company in November 2021. Former Suncity Executive Director Alvin Chau Cheok wa, was convicted in January 2023 to 18 years in prison for illicit exploitation of play and secret society, in a case that dropped from 85 to 18 the number of licenses for game promoters, known as 'junkets'. “Much of the reprehensible behavior in Macau has disappeared with the junkets. As long as things like that don't happen again, I don't expect any kind of short -term campaign, ”said Umansky.

item.title: Traffic | Lawyer appeals to the end of “moral judgments” with images
item.description:
The causal Luís Ho Ka considers that the use of traffic chambers can lead to cases in court, and that the images captured must be sent to the authorities, rather than shared on social networks
Lawyer Luís Ho Ka has defends the use of traffic surveillance chambers by drivers, but appeals to the government to take steps to avoid the use of images for “moral judgments”. The opinion of the causal was shared to the newspaper or Mun, following an incident at the head of the Portuguese School of Macao, in which images of a lawyer of Portuguese nationality were shared. Heard by the newspaper or Mun, the lawyer considered that recording videos by chambers installed on vehicles may be important, namely when there are accidents and the need to activate the automobile insurance. However, Ho Ka has pointed out that the vehicle cameras cannot be transformed into a mobile surveillance system used to make “moral judgments” on social networks. Ho also explained that the images captured by the vehicles must be delivered to the authorities, instead of being published online, and that those responsible for recording should only refer them to the authorities, following the legal proceedings provided. If the images have public interest, they can be used. However, if the use of images exceeds the scope of the process and investigations of the authorities, as is the case with publications on social networks, and if there are elements that can be considered as insulting or defamatory, then the person responsible for capturing and disclosure may face Criminal liability.
Legal problems Luís Ho Ka Hou also indicated that, according to the judicial perspective, the appropriate use of recorded images in traffic is captured the accidents, to hold it and cooperate with the authorities, in case it is necessary to collect evidence. If there is no consent of the recorded people, and if the content is published on social networks for moral judgments, then we are facing cases that are hardly under the appropriate recording, which may lead to violation of the law of personal data protection or other image rights. Ho ka has also warned that “judgments” on social networks can cause damage to the rights to privacy and the good name of the parties involved. About two weeks ago a driver was captured in traffic, after passing a red light, parking in a forbidden place and making an obscene gesture with children. The images, which allowed the driver to identify, were shared online, which held a campaign against the visa, including with dismissal requests from the employer, as well as several hate comments with xenophobic expressions.

item.title: Hospitality | More than 14.4 million guests in 2024
item.description:
Last year, Macao hotels hosted more than 14.4 million people, with the average occupancy rate of rooms reaching 86.4 percent, an annual climb of almost 5 percent. Room prices in 5-star hotels rose 2.8 percent, with the average spell fixed at 1,585 patacas
The Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) yesterday revealed that last year the hotel establishments of Macau hosted about 14,433,000 people, totaling a 6.4 percent increase with 2023. Statistical data show the significant climb of international customers, which totaled more than 1.1 million, with an annual growth of 57.4 percent. In this chapter highlight to guests from the Republic of Korea, who duplicated annually, and reached the 321 thousand. Also the number of guests of Malaysia (87,000), Japan (81,000), India (73,000) and Singapore (68,000) ascended 53.4, 49.1, 97.2 and 24.1 percent respectively. From a more operational perspective, in 2024 the industry registered an average occupancy rate of 86.4 percent guest rooms, plus 4.9 percentage points compared to 2023. The 5 -star hotels were the ones that recorded the highest occupancy rates Rooms (88.6 percent), with a rise of 6.1 percent. Medal sides During 2024, the average price of the five -star hotel rooms was 1,585 patacas, an increase of 2.8 percent compared to 2023, second data from the Macao Hotel Association, cited by the Tourism Services Directorate. The data reveal that last year's prices were only 0.6 percent below the 2019 registration The month of December exceeded the average prices practiced throughout 2024, with the average price in 4 and 5 star hotels reaching 1,624 patacas, yet a decrease of 8.1 percent compared to December 2023. Highlight for Last month that completed six consecutive months of homologous prices falls, a descent that began in July. At the end of last year there were 146 hotel establishments that provided public accommodation services (+4, compared to the end of the year 2023), providing a total of 43,000 rooms of guests (-7.8 percent).

item.title: Fires | New Law leads to the punishment of 83 people

item.title: Traffic | Accidents and fines shoot in 2024
item.description:
Last year closed with more than 15,500 road accidents, an annual rise of 14 percent. Despite the increase of injured, exceeding 5,300, the road deaths decreased to five. By 2024, authorities investigated nearly 190 million patacas in fines, plus 9.12 percent, although the offenses only rose 0.4 percent
More road accidents, more patacas in fines and less dead in road accidents. This can summarize 2024, according to the statistical data released by the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP). Last year, the roads and streets of Macau totaled 15,510 car accidents, a total that represented an annual rise of 14.36 percent compared to 2023. Still, 2024 was less deadly on the territory roads, with five fatalities (all related to drivers) against eight deaths recorded in 2023, ie a decrease of 37.5 percent. However, the number of injuries increased by almost 13 percent to a total of 5,341, climb driven by the increase of light injuries in a year when the wounds that needed hospitalization fell almost 50 percent. Also in the chapter of the claim, highlighting the increase of accidents involving pedestrians, with the annual climb of 6.7 percent to a total of 510 occurrences. Economic diversification The year 2024 was also a period when the amount of fines added almost 16 million patacas compared to the previous year. Last year, the total amount of the fines was almost 189.8 million patacas, a 9.12 percent increase compared to the same period. Despite the increase in the amount ease by the authorities, the infractions to the road traffic law and the road code kept practically the same level, with a slight rise of 0.4 percent to 703.8 thousand occurrences. In the chapter of fines, the parking lot continued to dominate, with 618,260 fines, the very broad majority for illegal parking on public roads. Still, parking fines decreased by 2.38 percent compared to 2023. However, the number of blocked vehicles increased by 24.5 percent by 2024 for a total of 2,226. At the opposite pole, CPSP's 2024 data reveal the return of a classic, with the climb almost 48 percent of taxi drivers' irregularities for a total of 870 cases. Regarding drivers caught driving under the influence of alcohol, the authorities accounted for 170 drunk people, an annual climb of almost 7 percent. Of these 170 people, 155 were male. One of the statistics that has been increasing in recent times in the chapter of fines is the pedestrians that cross the road without complying with traffic rules. Last year, the authorities fined 7,460 pawns, totaling a 58.5 percent increase.

item.title: Investigators ask the South Korean MP to accuse the deposit leader
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption office recommended yesterday to the Public Prosecution Service that the deposed president, Yoon Suk-Youol, is accused of rebellion and abuse of power by declaring martial law in December. The High employee corruption investigation office (CIO) has announced that it has transferred the case to the prosecutor, which has the power to formally accuse a South Korean head of state. Cio considers that Yoon conspired with then-National Defense Minister Kim Yong-Hyun and other military officers to start a riot, declaring martial law on the night of December 3. It argues, moreover, that Yoon has abused power by sending troops to the National Assembly (Parliament) to prevent deputies from revoking martial law. The Public Prosecution Service now has 11 days to decide whether or not to start the requested process. If Yoon is considered guilty of leading an insurrection, a crime for which a president has no immunity in the country, he may be sentenced to life imprisonment or the death penalty. Yoon is in custody at the Seoul Detention Center in Uiwang, south of Seoul, since January 15. The Constitutional Court is simultaneously made a judgment to determine whether or not to ratify the dismissal approved by parliamentarians on December 14. If the highest court in South Korea confirms the impeachment, early presidential elections have to be called within 60 days after the court decision. Yoon refuses to witness in the investigation into the alleged crime of rebellion. Yoon Suk-Youol surprised the country on December 3 by declaring martial law, a measure reminiscent of black days of the South Korean military dictatorship and that justified with the intention of protecting the country from “North Korean Communist forces” and “Eliminate elements hostile to the state”. Pressured by the deputies and thousands of protesters, Yoon was forced to revoke the decision hours later.

item.title: Afghanistan | Beijing calls for severe punishment for authors of the murder of Chinese citizen
item.description: China yesterday appealed to the Afghan authorities to do an "exhaustive investigation" and "severely punish" those responsible for the murder on Wednesday of a Chinese citizen who worked on a gold mine in Takhar's Afghan province. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said yesterday at a press conference that Beijing is “deeply shocked” with the attack. "China is against all forms of terrorism," said the spokesman, appealing to the "repression of the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations listed by the UN Security Council." "China will continue to pay close attention to the security situation in Afghanistan and to support Afghan authorities in combating all forms of terrorist violence and maintaining security and stability in the country," Mao added, urging the Afghan government to Take the necessary measures "to ensure the safety of citizens and Chinese organizations in the country." According to local police, the victim worked in a gold mine in the region, which borders Tajiquistan. A local branch of the Islamic State Islamic Group claimed the authorship of the attack. China is one of the few international actors that has maintained diplomatic relations with Afghanistan since the Taliban reached power in August 2021. The two countries share a small international border of just 76 kilometers in the eastern part of the so -called Wajan corridor, a remote passage in the Pamir Range. Chinese companies, with the support of Beijing, have sought to take advantage of opportunities to explore the vast deposits of non -developed resources from Afghanistan, especially Mes Aynak Mine, which is believed to contain the largest copper deposit in the world.

item.title: Commerce | Beijing says rates do not benefit China, USA or the world
item.description: The Chinese Ministry of Trade said yesterday that the United States imposition of customs of Chinese goods “would not benefit China, the United States or the world,” in the face of the threats of US leader Donald Trump. Folder spokesman He Yadong said at a press conference that his country "always maintained a consistent position" about increased rates. "China is willing to work with the US to put economic and commercial relations between the two countries in a stable, healthy and sustainable direction," he said. Asked whether his ministry has already reported with the new US administration team, he said China "always maintains contact with competent authorities" in the United States. Chinese diplomacy assured on Wednesday that "there are no winners in a trade war," after Trump advanced that he is considering imposing 10 percent rates on Chinese imports in retaliation for the flow of Fentanil. "We are talking about a 10 percent rate based on the fact that they are sending Fentanil to Mexico and Canada," Trump told journalists at the White House on Tuesday. The Republican leader said he said "the other day" with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, and that he told him that he did not want this "crap" in the country. Last year, about 70,000 deaths were recorded in the United States due to the consumption of that synthetic opioid. Trump team members included China on Monday, along with Canada and Mexico, among countries whose US commercial relationship would be revised by the Republican, which launched a trade war against the Asian nation during its first term.

item.title: Beijing orders funds to buy more shares to streamline markets
item.description: The Chinese government announced yesterday that it will order the funds of pension and investment to buy more actions of Chinese companies, to stimulate the country's financial squares after years of doldrums. Authorities said that, from this year, mutual funds should increase their participation in national actions, called Actions A, at least 10 percent per year, over the next three years. Commercial insurance funds will have to invest 30 percent of their new annual awards in the actions of action starting this year, they added. "This means that at least several hundred thousand long -term yuan millions of yuan will be added [to the shareholder market] every year," said Wu Qing, chairman of China's Securities Regulatory Committee. “The implementation of the various measures of the plan will further increase the capital's capital funds' capital affectation capacity, constantly expand the scale of investment, improve the supply and structure of funds in the capital market and consolidate the good conditions to The recovery of the capital market, ”he explained. The Chinese Communist Party announced this measure just before the biggest holiday of the year in China, the Lunar New Year, which begins on Wednesday, January 29. It is a time when families tend to increase spending on meals, travel and cash gifts for adult children and young people. Hong Kong and Shanghai markets climbed after the announcement, with the Shanghai Index composite initially winning about 1.5 percent, although in the middle of the session it was rising 0.8 percent. Hang Seng Kong's Hang Seng Index lost its first gains and remained virtually unchanged. Chinese shareholder markets have reached their maximum value before the Asian financial crisis and have since kept far below this level. The lack of assessment in the prices of actions, along with the fall in property prices, diminished investors' confidence, raising deflationary risks in the second largest economy in the world. Advances and Reforms To date, Chinese government efforts to make people spend more and save less have been mitigating success. An initiative to promote the purchase of energetically efficient vehicles and appliances through the payment of subsidies to consumers who deliver old versions of these articles increased sales. But action prices stopped after a brief recovery at the end of last year. Wu stated that pension funds will be required to reformulate the way they evaluate their performance and that companies will be encouraged to perform more action repurchase and pay higher dividends to provide better income to shareholders. “This is a very important institutional advance for the entry of medium and long term funds in the market. It can be said that it solves a problem that has been solved for many years, ”he added. "Sales of the main shareholders and the high market volatility have impaired Chinese financial squares," said Law Meng, Chinese action analyst at UBS Securities, in a comment widespread yesterday. "The willingness of long -term investors to participate in the scholarship market has decreased," he added. "The proposal to reform the management of market value directly addresses this issue, because it is directly related to the sense of gain of investors," he said.

item.title: Ukraine | Beijing and Brasilia highlight “growing consensus” to find political solution
item.description:
The two nations continue to effort to find a solution that end the conflict in Ukraine. Wang Yi and Celso Amorim, spoke yesterday by phone
Chinese diplomacy chief Wang Yi yesterday highlighted the “growing consensus of all parts to promote a political solution” for the war in Ukraine during a telephone conversation with Brazilian special counselor Celso Amorim. In 2024 Wang and Amorim advanced with a joint proposal to end the conflict between Russia and Ukraine. "The goal is to gather the consensus of the" global south "and create and accumulate conditions for peace conversations," said Wang Yi yesterday, according to a statement issued by the Chinese Foreign Ministry. Wang stated that China and Brazil have “similar development trajectories and highly complementary economies” and that “strong confidence and mutual friendship established between the heads of state of both countries have launched a solid political base for both cooperation to be carried out in hand. comprehensive ”. "China firmly supports the leadership of Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, so that the Brazilian people explore a path of development, according to their national conditions," added the minister, while transmitted his "support ”To the South American country during its current presidency of the BRICS emerging countries bloc. Wang also expressed his hope of "working with Brazil to defend genuine multilateralism." Amorim called for efforts to "build a community of a common destination between Brazil and China for a fairer world and a more sustainable planet." "Brazil and China, as emerging powers, can further strengthen cooperation and play a greater role in maintaining world peace and combating climate change," said the special counselor of the Brazilian presidency. Preferential friend According to official data, China has been the largest commercial partner in Brazil since 2008. The Chinese market was the destination of 30 percent of Brazilian exports in 2023, when sales to the Asian country totaled $ 104 billion, mostly constituted by food products and raw materials. China, in turn, maintains investments in Brazil of about $ 40 billion, which in recent years have been applied in the energy sector.

item.title: Davos | Beijing warns of “unimaginable” consequences of division of the world
item.description: Chinese vice-master-master, Ding Xuexiang, warned yesterday at the World Economic Forum in Davos, to the dangers of a possible division of the world into two separate systems, warning that the consequences would be “unimaginable” and would severely impair humanity. In speaking in the Swiss city, Ding stressed that the international community is increasingly concerned with this risk, since “it would be very difficult to face common challenges,” including climate change, food safety and energy transition, ““ If the world is divided. ” The Chinese leader warned of the risks of confrontation in the "worst scenario", a situation where "no country could be indifferent." "Davos remains a fundamental forum for discussing global issues and fostering international cooperation, promoting new ideas for common progress," he said. Ding also appealed to global solidarity, stressing that international cooperation is essential to overcome turbulence and building a common future. According to the ruler, China has been a firm defender of multilateralism and is still committed to the law -based international system, with the UN as a center. The deputy minister stressed the commitment of his country in building an inclusive economic globalization, noting that, despite the “disagreements regarding its distribution”, it remains a “advantageous trend for all”. China is an “defender and builder” of the international order, he said.

item.title: Sunac | First real estate prosecutor to restructure debt
item.description:
Plans to pay the debt of more than 15 billion Yuan were approved by creditors
Sunac, once one of China's greatest real estate promoters, became the first sector company to successfully restructure its debt issued in the “onshore”, after being able to support creditors. In a statement sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, where it is quoted, the company stated that the creditors of these obligations, which was missing about 15.4 billion Yuan, approved the plan presented by the company. The proposal provided for a reduction to less than half of this amount and offered several options, such as prolongation of obligations until 2034, with no obligation to start paying them by 2029. Sunac had already been a pioneer among Chinese promoters when, in October 2023, he obtained the approval of the Hong Kong court for the agreement he had reached with creditors to restructure about $ 10.2 billion of debt issued in the markets International (“offshore”). The Standard & Poor's (S&P) debt notation agency stated at the time that Sunac was to pave the way for the offshore debt restructuring of other Chinese promoters in similar situations, since it not only sought to extend obligations to gain time, but also Included instruments such as debt swaps. However, on March 10, the state asset manager Cinda filed a settlement against the company in Hong Kong for non -payment of a $ 30 million loan. The first hearing was scheduled for March 19. This case is distinguished from similar ones, such as those who also face in hong Kong giants such as Evergrande or Country Garden, because the complainant is a Chinese state company and not a private creditor, although Beijing has repeatedly promised measures to stabilize The real estate market in recent months. Wound The prosecutor's actions in Hong Kong fell more than 25 percent following this news. Yesterday, despite the agreement with the 'ONShore' creditors, they fell 2.41 percent during the morning of the session. Sunac had a total liability of about 896 billion Yuan at the end of the first half of 2024, during which a net loss of 14.957 billion yuan. The financial situation of many Chinese real estate companies worsened after Beijing was announced in August 2020 restrictions on access to bank financing for prosecutors who had accumulated a high level of debt, including Evergrande, with a liability of almost 330,000 million dollars.

item.title: Afghanistan | Talibans claim that Chinese citizen was killed
item.description: A Chinese citizen was killed in northeastern Afghanistan, announced yesterday a Taliban police spokesman, although the murder of foreigners was rare in the country, especially since the removal of US troops in 2021. Police spokesman Mohammed Akbar in Takhar province said the man was killed on Tuesday night by "unknown people," when he was on his way to Dasht-e-Qala district. Akbar said the Chinese citizen, nicknamed Li, traveled to an unknown destination with his interpreter and without informing security authorities. The interpreter was not injured in the incident, according to Akbar. “Police began their initial investigation. Stay tuned for more detail, ”added Akbar without providing more information. A group called the National Mobilization Front claimed responsibility for the murder and said that its combatants targeted the Chinese vehicle. The group claimed that Li was training taliban secret services in monitoring social networking platforms, without evidence. Asked about the incident, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said yesterday that he is not familiar with the matter. "I believe that the China Embassy in Afghanistan will do everything within your reach to protect the safety of Chinese citizens and we will follow the situation," he said. China is of particular importance to the Taliban, who are cutting foreign investment and regional alliances in the face of their continuing isolation in the international scene due to their repression against women.

item.title: Francisco Leandro, author and professor at the University of Macao: “Support from the country reinforces the role of Macao platform”

This integration facilitated Macao's economic growth, making it a vital part of the country's broader economic strategy. Macao's socioeconomic development strategy is consecrated in the policy “a center, a platform, a base”. This picture aims to position MSA as a world center of tourism and leisure, reinforcing its attraction as a global tourist destination. In addition, MSAR acts as a platform for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, promoting international trade and cultural exchange. Rae de Macao is also becoming a base of exchange and cultural cooperation, promoting cultural interactions and the conservation of heritage. This multifaceted approach supports Macao's integration into national development plans and reinforces its global presence. The unique position of MSA as a bridge between China, in particular the great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay, and Portuguese-speaking countries underline their strategic importance. The concept of “a platform, three centers” enhances Macao's role in promoting economic and cultural exchange. This platform allowed the city to serve as a platform for trade, investment and cultural interactions, reinforcing the ties between China and the Lusophone world. Macau's development as a tourism and leisure center, along with the promotion of four main industries - conventions and exhibitions, cultural and creative industries, traditional Chinese medicine and modern financial services - diversified its economy. These initiatives not only boosted economic activity, but also reinforced the global attraction of Macau as a tourist destination. The central government adopted a series of policies for Macao. Is there any specific measure that has benefited your sector? As? The interior of China and the Macao Economic Economic Partnership Agreement (Cepa) play a crucial role in the great bay and in the promotion of ties with Portuguese -speaking countries. By promoting commercial and economic cooperation, the strain reinforces the position of MSA as a bridge between China and Lusophone countries. This agreement facilitates access to the market, investment and cultural exchange, promoting Macao as an international business center. In addition, the strain supports the integration of Macau in the Great Bay area, contributing to regional development and economic diversification. This strategic role underlines the importance of Macau in the broader economic and diplomatic initiatives in the country. The promotion of higher education in RAE de Macao also played a crucial role in its development. In investing in education and research, Macau contributed to the objectives of national development and was positioned as a center of academic excellence. This bet on education has allowed to create a skilled labor, essential to sustain economic growth and innovation. The University of Macao is highly considered in global academic rankings. It was classified in 180th place at the World University Rankings 2025 by Times Higher Education, and 245th at QS World University Rankings 2025. In addition, the University of Macao is ranked 262nd in the best global universities by US News & World Report. These classifications reflect the university's commitment to excellence in teaching and research, particularly in areas such as Artificial Intelligence, Engineering and Social Sciences. The university's strong international collaboration and innovative investigation contribute significantly to their estimated global position. This year is the third anniversary of the creation of the Guangdong-Macau in-depth cooperation zone in Hengqin. In your opinion, how should Macau continue to take advantage of the advantages of the zone to develop himself and the education sector? Hengqin's cooperation zone is one of the main objectives of Macao's modernization efforts. This zone has been fundamental to boosting innovation and economic diversification, providing a space for new industries and promoting a narrower integration with the continent. The area exemplifies Macau's commitment to modernization and its strategic role in regional development. Macao is a unique mix of Chinese and Portuguese cultures. In your opinion, how can this merger help the nation to reinforce communication with the international community and tell the good stories of China? Macao is a fascinating mix of cultures, where the East meets the West in a unique and harmonious way. His linguistic landscape is a testimony of his multicultural heritage. The Chinese is the official language and the Portuguese language can be used for official purposes, reflecting the historical ties of Macao with Portugal and its Chinese roots. English is also widely spoken, especially in business and tourism, which makes Macau a truly multilingual society. The legal system of MSAR is another domain in which this cultural mixture is evident. Based on the Portuguese Civil Law System, it was adapted to the local context under the “one country, two systems” principle. This double legal system allows a unique mix of Chinese and Western legal traditions, ensuring that Macau's legal environment is familiar to its residents and accessible to international companies. Macao's approach to the extrajudicial resolution of commercial conflicts further enhances its multicultural policy. The city offers various arbitration and mediation services that serve both local and international parts, promoting the efficient and friendly resolution of disputes. Macao's open city policy and multicultural attitude are the key to its success as a global center. The city welcomes people from around the world, promoting a diverse and inclusive community. This opening is reflected in its festivals, its gastronomy and their daily lives, where different cultures coexist and enrich each other. Essentially, the mix of language, legal systems and multicultural attitudes of Macau makes it a unique and dynamic place that establishes bridges between cultures and promotes global bonds. What achievements would you like to see by Macau in the next 25 years? In short, Macao's future is brilliant, with greater integration with mainland China, its central role in international trade, diversified economic growth and a strong global presence. These elements will ensure Macao's continuous success and development at the world scene. The 25th anniversary of Macao's return to the Fatherland celebrates not only a successful diplomatic achievement, but also the continuous contributions of the region to national and world development. Macao's strategic initiatives and their integration in national plans underline their importance as a dynamic region and facing the future.

Doesn't Cartoon have no place on social networks? (Hesitates) It may appear, but it doesn't seem to me… Journalism is said to die and we cartoonists are going first. I think this is the trend.
